Long-Description: Example 1 is a pair of declarations followed by a single while loop statement.

Example 2 contains a syntax error. It has two declarations followed by three statements but the grammar only permits a single statement. Since there is an error this test will check the error output and the exit status.
Example 3 has a number of nested ifs and while loops. This is a useful test of a code generator because it needs unique label names allocated to each if and while.
